title: Riot, if you still give a shit about ARAM, make it all champions.
body:
fuck the aram accounts.

fuck the whiners.

make it all random.

when I run up against teams that have at least 2 champs with some bullshit that you can't answer with your own teamcomp, it makes it such a utterly miserable experience that I question why I still play ARAMs, and I have thousands of games of ARAM in my belt.

and to everyone who tells me to just not play the mode: you're part of the problem.

> [{quoted}](name=InfinitexMortal,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AE3MPys5,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-01-13T00:12:08.670+0000)

this is why accounts that own most/all champions that are amazing in ARAM are a problem. they can get a champion that a lot of teams cannot answer consistently.

It also picks your champ from he free rotation btw

I know because it gave me Azir once

"Fuck the whiners" ... and this thread is what, exactly?

At any rate, even IF the mode included champions that you don't own, the same scenarios will still occur. It happens. The point of ARAM isn't for totally balanced play, it's throwing at you a random champion from your pool. Some games are going to be stomps due to the nature of the game. Actually recently I think I've had ARAM games lasting longer than most of my games on the rift, and they've been really fun. Making this change wouldn't really change anything. People will still whine about certain comps or champions, and then we'd have people complaining about how they have to play champions they don't own.

I agree. If it's "all champions", there's still a chance you'll receive a champ you own and/or you're good at. Nothing would be changed, and people would still complain.
Instead of making it "all champs", instead make it "all champs you own"; if you're going to do badly, then at least you won't be able to whine that Riot gave you a champ you can't play.

That's literally how it works right now.

Unlocking all champions would mean that the OP champs could still get rolled out, but it wouldn't be a gamemode of only Blitz, Ezreal, Sona, Veigar, etc.

Actually you have the free champs that you could get stuck with. I got stuck with Nocturne today.... ran out of rerolls, no trades availible etc... I just played the nocturne. I did poorly but my team was in line for a win until we had an afk. Anyway, this is just to say that it happens.

I do like the suggestion to make it randomly select between all champions, however, I could see going the other way and going with only champions that you own. Either way is better than the current system of allowing players to get stuck with one of the free champions.

Actually recently I think I've had ARAM games lasting longer than most of my games on the rift, and they've been really fun. Making this change wouldn't really change anything. People will still whine about certain comps or champions, and then we'd have people complaining about how they have to play champions they don't own.

the percentage of "shit happening" would be vastly lower with all champions being available. I could accept it much easier when it would happen under the stipulation of everyone has all champions available.

I'm just not certain it would make things better in the long run. Like yeah it would shit on ARAM accounts but for the majority of players who play ARAM it would force them into champions they don't want to play. I know that the "random" aspect sometimes gives you a champ you don't want to play, but let's face it, a lot of people don't own champions like {{champion:28}} {{champion:266}}  for a reason, unless you're really good with them. This would just increase dodges and toxicity from people who got a champion they don't own. Something would have to change along with it (re-roll rate/limit, tower strength, etc) for this to be more "acceptable."

I personally have played the game long (and often) enough that I just buy champions that seem interesting to me.  It doesn't matter whether I'm good with them or think I'll spend time learning them.  I just buy ones that I want to play around with.

That does make it a bit annoying though when I get someone like Kalista in ARAM when I almost purely play immobile mages.  I still enjoy the act of playing her, but I'm extremely likely to be a liability to my team if I'm given her.

Should I just never buy another non-ARAM strong champion or just keep giving myself a worse pool?  It really does feel lame when I'm given one of my silly buys and the enemy team has Lux, Sona, Caitlyn, etc.

Opening up the options will still keep the mode competitive for those who want to play it seriously without making it suck for people who just own too many champions.  Besides, it seems more in the spirit of ARAM for people to be playing champions they aren't totally comfortable on.

The difference will be that players aren't punished for buying champions that aren't optimal in ARAM.  It'll be a (in the long run) more balanced environment while still maintaining (and in fact increasing) the randomness and chaos that make the mode fun.
It's also quite miserable to be forced into playing champions you have no idea how to play (or don't want to play period. Looking at you, Trynd) and that won't drop key frags or chests.

That's the whole point of ARAM.
If you don't like that, don't play.
That's what ARAM is for. If you only want to play specific champions, go play 3v3 or SR.

I own every champion (currently all 134), and got 6380 ARAM games played.
I got ~twice (used to be three times) as many takedowns in that mode than I got farm in Classic.

What I would like to see is more severe punishments for ARAM dodging.
If anyone queue up for a random game mode ("All _Random_, All Mid" - ARAM), but can't handle a random champion, they got no business in that queue. You suck it up and play what you end up with after rolls and trades.
_Though I would like to see a 3rd reroll introduced, considering the current number of champions._

Remove Mark, bring back Zephyr, Twin Shadows, The Lightbringer, and Hextech Sweeper, revert the Guardian's Horn changes, and give Atma's Impaler and Deathfire Grasp a test-run, and it's all good.

Not sure if I agree with an all-champion policy though. It doesn't matter to me anymore, but I played Jarvan IV there before I unlocked him, and got an S-.
"You can not get chests or key fragments on champions you do not own" (or similar).
Riot, if you still give a shit about ARAM, *do not* make it all champions.

yea. the problem isn't the selective pool or "aram accounts", it's just noobs who don't know what they're doing. giving them champs they've never seen in their life is just gonna make things worse.

imo, aram comps should be picked by an algorithm, instead of simply being pure random. so high winrate champs will get "balanced" with a low winrate champ on the same team.

or alternatively, champs are split into 5 different tiers, and the team gets 1 from each tier.

rerolls will have to factor these in as well.

this should help prevent the full poke team with insane range that can beat up your all-melee team in 10mins.

That makes it very polarizing, though. Like 'Ok someone else on your team got Sona have fun playing Evelynn for 20 minutes'. If you've guaranteed that only one or two people on a team are going to have fun at a time, nobody will play the mode.

Determining these tiers would also be almost impossible. Just working out which champions ARE too strong or too weak takes an entire live gameplay team. Trying to sort them into brackets would be a logistical nightmare, especially given the high levels of variance present with ARAM's wacky team comps. Champions that steamroll some comps can be shut down completely by others.

I think ARAM is fine as it is: a fast-paced, high-variance, teamfight-based version of League of Legends. Occasionally you get comp stomped, but that's a price I'm willing to pay.

you can still swap the "good" champs and reroll the "bad" ones. accounts should definitely not be stuck with one aram champ tier every game, and in fact i think it should simply rotate each game. maybe finishing a game with lower tier champs can give more reroll points or something.

the simplest way to do the tiers would be just going by winrates. it's not necessarily affected by excess variance, since the data set is humongous. i mean, if they really wanted to churn out fair match-ups, they could do even more complicated algorithms that take into account which champs counter which ones, or comps that have too much cc, etc... but nobody expects that much intricacy.

if the game is just about who lucks out with a better comp, it feels pretty bad. there isn't much incentive to stick it out with a {{champion:19}} {{champion:77}} {{champion:102}} team when the opponent has {{champion:110}} {{champion:115}} {{champion:161}}. either way, this is just to discuss potential improvements, suss out their weaknesses and maybe brainstorm implementation strategies. no point saying "let's not change" in such a thread.

warwick is playable... but you basically can't do anything until you farm a few tank items. meanwhile, if you are facing a poke-heavy comp, they can farm YOU.  you can't initiate with ult most of the game, since anyone with hard cc can easily cancel it, or they can just hard focus and kill you.

in short: warwick is heavily dependent on comp.

> [ARAM] has a much lower average elo than say ranked

That's not how Elo/MMR works. The highest ARAM MMRs are lower than the highest SR MMRs, but that's because ARAM has a smaller playerbase, so there's fewer people to take MMR from.

>all the very good ranked players (plat+) don't play aram at all

Source? There might be an argument that people grinding ranked don't have time/energy to play ARAM, but actual data backing that up would be nice.

>what may seem like a good aram elo is just average when put in perspective

Again, not how MMR works. A good MMR cannot possibly also be average.

>for example my aram elo is supposedly top 1-2% when my ranked elo was only plat (top 10% ranked) last time I played ranked

Separate game modes have separate MMRs, and SR tests a different skillset than ARAM. It makes little sense to use SR MMR to compare ARAM MMR.

if you ask 100 kids to run 100 meters, then ask 100 adults to do the same, the average speed for the kids is going to be lower than the average speed for the adults, since kids run slower. top 50 on the kids ladder doesn't have the same value as top 50 on the adult ladder, despite the 2 groups having the same numbers. the distribution may be the same, 1200 starting elo, 2000+ top end, but the skillset this elo stands for isn't. Kinda like universities degrees, popular university / unknown one.

we bump into eachother now and then whenever an aram discussion shows up haha, I don't know about you, but I am not a very good player by any mean, I'm okay I guess, but that's it really, my mechanics aren't anything grand, and my game knowledge is just above average I guess, but again that's it, I'm miles away from all the diamond+ players with crazy mechanics etc and if the games I am in where everyone plays like me are the top 2%, it becomes obvious the competition isn't very good and the average aram player just isn't very good

sure, you could make an argument about the games modes being different, but that's far fetched, and let's face it, not what is happening. it's just 2 different groups of players, one really try hard, competitive, with money and fame at the top, and another one really casual that likes to mess around, and those players make the bulk of the 2 groups.

I think, rather than comparing kids racing to adults racing, comparing a bunch of people playing poker to a bunch of people playing football would be more fitting. It simply doesn't make sense to compare results for one contest under the framework for the other contest. Being the best quarterback doesn't mean much when everyone's just sitting around the poker table. The skillsets might have some overlap, but they aren't the same (e.g. the existence of one trick ponies in SR).

So, yes, the modes are definitely different, and it's not far-fetched that that impacts perceived skill. I do agree though that ARAM's single queue results in a weird mess of competitive and casual players, which itself results in a weird mess of gameplay quality.

I'm not sure how accurate the MMR-equivalent distribution graph is, but the value itself seems fairly accurate. At the very least, it roughly matches all the other MMRs from various sources over the years.

As someone who owns all but 1 champ (Taliyah or whatever. The earthbender chick), I have to comment that it doesn't feel random even with that many. A roster of ~130 champions, and I get the same ~10 pretty consistently. I've rolled Skarner 6 times in a row (with 5 being dodges, but still), played Vladimir in 3-4 out of 10 games, and seem to see the same exact champions in every game.

I'd really like to know what exactly they use to randomize everything, because with so many choices, I should definitely see more variety I feel. That's just my two cents though. For a more relevant comment, I don't believe much would change because of what I said.

TL;DR: The randomize function on ARAM sucks regardless of number of champs.
**All random All champs ONLY IF they REMOVE the trade option! So those fckers gonna play what they get.**

Playing against similar champions all the time in aram is frustrating. I hope they look to address this. Rerolls kind of tuned it even more towards seeing the same champions. I'd be a little worried that the number of dodges would increase if they made aram assign champions randomly from the total selection, but I think that's a much smaller price to pay for more interesting games. Hopefully the people that only wish to stomp games where they are on a comfortable aram champ will dodge more often and tire of participating in a format that was originally fun and silly and relaxed. People wanting to play specific champions might consider avoiding a format designated all RANDOM all mid. There are several other places where they can enjoy the champion they wish to play without infringing on the principle of this game mode.
ARAM just needs all champs unlocked instead of champs owned + rotating.
I agree, make all champs available, would also be a good way to learn champions that you don't own.

Okay seriously all i do is play aram if no1 i kno is online or i try to wind down after work, so that being said i have run into my teams all adc and they are mostly ap and 1 tank they won, ive run into my whole team is tank with no range and no go in until 1 of us hits  lvl6 and the whole team is 3 ap and 2 ad and we won. I think aram is suppose to be a fun casual game type not to take so damn seriously and i also think its a great place to focus your skills like team fights and find new ways to play champs. Think about it if you are always the guy (or girl) stuck on some tank against ranged and/or cc you shouldve learned by now some tricks to avoid it or go threw it. I mean serilously aram has helped me position better in teamfights and dodge incoming abilities. You either play it for a time killer or you play it to hone your skills, there is no competive aram!
